alert.note: Alert for Monterey; San Benito; Santa Clara; Santa Cruz (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 19 at 7:52AM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central and northern California, including the following counties, in central California, Monterey and San Benito. In northern California, Santa Clara and Santa Cruz. * WHEN...Until 945 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 751 AM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... San Jose, Salinas, Watsonville, Gilroy, Morgan Hill, Seaside, Marina, Corralitos, Prunedale, Interlaken, Amesti, Freedom, Moss Landing, Castroville, Brown Valley Road, Boronda, Uvas Canyon Park, Spreckels, San Juan Bautista and Aromas. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

area.areaDesc: Monterey; San Benito; Santa Clara; Santa Cruz
